meanings.definition: The act or process of removing color from something.
meanings.sent1: The decolorizations of the fabric were done carefully to ensure a perfect result.
meanings.sent2: The decolorizations of the painting gave it a new, fresh look.
meanings.sent3: The decolorizations of the crayons turned them into magical wands for the art class.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a decolorizations, brightening up the room with its pureness.
meanings.sent5: The decolorizations of the sky at dawn painted a serene picture.

meanings.definition: The state of being colorless or lacking in color.
meanings.sent1: The decolorizations of the sky during the storm made it look eerie.
meanings.sent2: The decolorizations of the flowers in winter were a stark contrast to their summer vibrancy.
meanings.sent3: The decolorizations of the world in a black-and-white movie gave it a classic charm.
meanings.sent4: His words had a decolorizations that drained the excitement from the room.
meanings.sent5: The decolorizations of the room made it feel cold and unwelcoming.
